x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.author: Nutanix
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.description:
Kubernetes is an open-source platform for automating deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers across clusters of hosts, providing container-centric infrastructure.

License:
  • Apache License 2.0
Hardware Requirement:
  • By default, three controller VMs each 2 vCPU, 2GB RAM and three minion 4 vCPU, 4GB RAM
  • OS Disk 8GB, Data Disk 3 x 10GB.
Resources Installed:
  • Etcd version v3.2.11
  • Kubernetes 1.8.x to 1.10.x
Operating System:
  • CentOS Linux release 7.4-1801-01
  • Select the AMI on AWS.
  • Select the Image on GCP.
Platform:
  • AHV
  • AWS
  • GCP
Lifecycle:
  • ScaleOut
  • ScaleIn
  • Upgrade
Limitations:
  • User containers will be scheduled only on Minions.
  • A unique Service IP Subnet has to be used while deploying blueprint, and the subnet has to be routable to any one of the minions within your network.
  • Self signed certificates are created at run time during deployment. User cannot create certificates.
  • For evaluation purpose only. Not recommended for production use.
  • Upgrade flow is experimental. During Upgrade flow containers will be moved to different nodes which might cause data loss. Your containers might terminate due to resource starvation make sure that you have enough resources (CPU & RAM).
Accessibility:
  • https://[CONTROLLER_IP]:6443
  • Admin certificates are available in controller node $HOME/CA
x_nuta2_nutanix_ca_nutanix_marketplaceit.description_markdown: Kubernetes is an open-source platform for automating deployment, scaling, and operations of application containers across clusters of hosts, providing container-centric infrastructure. #### License: * Apache License 2.0 #### Hardware Requirement: * By default, three controller VMs each 2 vCPU, 2GB RAM and three minion 4 vCPU, 4GB RAM * OS Disk 8GB, Data Disk 3 x 10GB. #### Resources Installed: * Etcd version v3.2.11 * Kubernetes 1.8.x to 1.10.x #### Operating System: * CentOS Linux release 7.4-1801-01 * Select the [AMI](https://goo.gl/td2eJJ) on AWS. * Select the [Image](https://goo.gl/51oD7D) on GCP. #### Platform: * AHV * AWS * GCP #### Lifecycle: * ScaleOut * ScaleIn * Upgrade #### Limitations: * User containers will be scheduled only on Minions. * A unique Service IP Subnet has to be used while deploying blueprint, and the subnet has to be routable to any one of the minions within your network. * Self signed certificates are created at run time during deployment. User cannot create certificates. * For evaluation purpose only. Not recommended for production use. * Upgrade flow is experimental. During Upgrade flow containers will be moved to different nodes which might cause data loss. Your containers might terminate due to resource starvation make sure that you have enough resources (CPU & RAM). #### Accessibility: * https://[CONTROLLER_IP]:6443 * Admin certificates are available in controller node $HOME/CA
